meanings.definition: A person who haggles or bargains over prices.
meanings.sent1: The higglers at the market always try to get the best deal.
meanings.sent2: The higglers were negotiating the price of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The higglers had a friendly competition to see who could get the lowest price.
meanings.sent4: In the world of higglers, every cent counts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the higglers haggling under the sun stayed with me.

meanings.definition: To haggle or bargain over prices.
meanings.sent1: Customers often higgle with street vendors to get a better price.
meanings.sent2: She decided to higgle over the cost of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would higgle playfully over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The two friends would higgle back and forth, trying to reach a fair deal.
meanings.sent5: As the auctioneer started the bidding, the crowd began to higgle excitedly.
